results.title: Christopher Columbus
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Gordon Clark, Michael Latham and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers”.
Stresses the most fascinating part of Columbus’s life - the period after he discovered the American continent in 1492. Presented by David Attenborough. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary level.

results.title: Christo: wrapped coast
results.brief_description: Examines the art event by Bulgarian artsist Christo, of wrapping a section of the Little Bay coastline near Sydney. As the wrapping progresses, the coastline takes on a glacial appearance, changes to a wrapped bundle, and is finally ripped apart by the force of the wind. Narrated by Kevin McCarthy, photographed and edited by Christian Blackwood.

results.title: Christmas under fire
results.creator_credit: Crown Film Unit and GPO Film Unit
results.brief_description: An emotional commentary, written and spoken by Quentin Reynolds, one of WWII’s best reporters, on the eve of his departure back to America, with a film report on how British people were celebrating their first Christmas under blitz conditions in 1940. Shows them in shelters, on watch in fields, in the city and at their posts proving to the world that the people of Britain are equal to their testing, unbeaten, unconquered and unafraid. Carols sung by the choir of Kings College Chapel, Cambridge.

results.title: Christmas Island
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson and Christmas Island Phosphate Commission
results.brief_description: Christmas Island, in the Indian Ocean, provides a large part of the phosphate rock requirements used in Australia and New Zealand. The mining of this phosphate is the only industry on the island. This film covers all aspects of the mining operations, and also shows the social and domestic life of the people engaged in the industry.

results.title: Christmas in Germany: a story of giving
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: This film is a dramatisation of a little girl’s perceptions of Christmas in a German town, highlighting the charming traditional Christmas customs and delicate decorations and crafts of Germany. This film is suitable for lower secondary school levels. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Christmas Crackers
results.brief_description: This amateur film made by John Sprod re-enacts a reunion between the family members when the four men return to Adelaide from active service overseas during the Second World War.

constellations_other.name: Australia and WW2
constellations_other.description: A constellation exploring representations of Australians during World War 2.

results.description: This amateur film made by John Sprod re-enacts a reunion between the family members when the four men return to Adelaide from active service overseas during the Second World War. Through the course of the film, Mrs Sprod welcomes home her son George from the Army, John from the Airforce, Dan from the Navy and her brother-in-law Des Carter from the Army. The film includes captions and illustrations drawn by George Sprod as well as acting performances from nine members of the immediate family.
description_for_label: This amateur film made by John Sprod re-enacts a reunion between the family members when the four men return to Adelaide from active service overseas during the Second World War. Through the course of the film, Mrs Sprod welcomes home her son George from the Army, John from the Airforce, Dan from the Navy and her brother-in-law Des Carter from the Army. The film includes captions and illustrations drawn by George Sprod as well as acting performances from nine members of the immediate family.
